text: The black-hooded antshrike (Thamnophilus bridgesi) is a species of bird in the Thamnophilidae family. It is found in Costa Rica and Panama. As its name, males are mostly black, with three rows of well-marked white spots on the wings. However, females are usually brown, and only its tail is black. == References == * BirdLife International 2004. Thamnophilus bridgesi. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 27 July 2007. Category:Tyranni Category:Birds of Central America
title: Black-hooded antshrike
